greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle in which n-th row contains n smallest multiples of the n-th prime.
comment: 0. A000040 (primes) gives initial terms of rows.
1. A033286 contains the final terms of rows.
2. Sum of the n-th row = prime(n)*A000217(n), by definition.
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8128
formula: T(n,k) = k*prime(n) with 1 <= k <= n. - _Bruno Berselli_, Sep 05 2017
xref: Row sums give A196421. - _Omar E. Pol_, Mar 12 2012
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Nov 04 2002
